suppress.notes: Suppress this CVE that is a wontfix from spring because it is about how spring provides a java deserialisation and invocation endpoint implementation that if you expose unauthenticated would be risky. They argue that's a you (app) problem.

Spring-framework libraries always have groupId org.springframework with no further extension, so suppress the spring_framework package identification for old and third party libs that merely include spring jars
false positive for commons_net file name: commons-codec-*.jar
false positive for commons_net file name: commons-text-*.jar
false positive for commons_net file name: commons-logging-*.jar

false positive as spring boot uses safe constructor in snakeyaml, see:
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/33457
file name: snakeyaml-1.33.jar

6.5.0 version is only used by spotbugs who do not exercise vulnerability:
https://github.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/discussions/2251
file name: bcel-6.5.0.jar
false positive due to incorrect CPE targeting 4.1.86 not 4.1.86.Final file name: netty-*-4.1.86.Final.jar
